intro: Ecbolium betonica, commonly known as greater betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant features square stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy and lance-shaped. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
